business.headline: ED raids in Mumbai, Haryana against pharma company in Rs 220-crore fraud caseDuring the search operations in Mumbai and Haryana's Yamunanagar, movable assets including bank funds, Demat accounts valued at Rs 14.53 crore were seized or frozen.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Israel pounds military targets in Iran in revenge strikes Live UpdatesThe Israeli attack on Iran risks escalating the ongoing conflict into an all-out war across the Middle East, where Hamas in Gaza and Hezbollah in Lebanon are already engaged in a fight with Israel.

New satellite images confirm initial disengagement in Depsang and DemchokThe latest satellite images, taken on Friday, showed a reduction in structures at multiple locations, signalling a potential end to the prolonged standoff in the Himalayan region ahead of winter.

Calcium, Vitamin D3 tablets among 49 drugs that fail quality testsThe drugs control panel also flagged four medicines which were manufactured by fake companies.

I went to Delhi T3 to find out how long airport goodbyes take. This is what I foundThe kiss-and-say-goodbye routine certainly seems to not work with Indians. Families coming to the airport to drop their loved ones off often stay for a minimum of 30 minutes.

Washington Post won't endorse candidate in US polls after Jeff Bezos move: ReportsIn a report by The Washington Post — reporting on its own inner workings — cited two anonymous people familiar with the event, saying that an endorsement of Democratic candidate Kamala Harris had been written but was not published.

'Lady don' who lured victim in Delhi Burger King shooting case arrested from UPAccording to the police, 19-year-old Annu Dhankar lured the victim and was present with him when he was shot dead at a Burger King outlet in West Delhi's Rajouri Garden. Dhankar was arrested while trying to flee to Nepal from UP.

Not here as celebrity, am here as mother: Beyonce at Kamala Harris's rally Taking the stage at the Harris rally in her hometown of Houston, Beyoncé said that she is not here as a celebrity but as a mother.

Why is India in best geopolitical position today? Centre briefs parliamentary panel about Canada row, says issue 'sensitive': SourcesIn the meeting, Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri shared some details about the diplomatic standoff between India and Canada. Misri also told the panel that since the issue is very sensitive, more details will be shared at a later time, sources said.

Elon Musk's PAC awards $1 million to two registered voters, despite DOJ warningWith less than two weeks to the US presidential election, Elon Musk's pro-Trump Super PAC awarded $1 million each to two registered voters in Michigan and Wisconsin. The move follows a warning from the Department of Justice (DOJ) that such payments might violate federal laws prohibiting incentives for voter registration.

Abhimanyu Easwaran, Nitish Reddy in India's jumbo squad for Australia TestsThe BCCI has announced a jumbo 18-member squad for the Border Gavaskar Trophy series against Australia. Abhimanyu Easwaran returned to the Test squad with Nitish Reddy and Harshit Rana earning a maiden call-up in the format.

MS Dhoni to play in IPL 2025? Former CSK skipper opens up Former Chennai Super Kings captain and India legend MS Dhoni opened up on his chances of playing in IPL 2025 and his undying passion for the sport. CSK have the option of retaining Dhoni for Rs 4 crore.

AAP claims attack bid on Arvind Kejriwal by BJP-linked people, party deniesAAP leaders launched an attack against the BJP on Friday, alleging that people linked to the party attempted to attack Arvind Kejriwal. The Delhi BJP chief refuted the charges.

Biden apologises for forced 150-year-old Native American boarding school policyFrom 1819 through the 1970s, these boarding schools' purpose was to culturally assimilate Native Americans by forcibly removing them from their families, communities, religions and cultural beliefs.

sports.headline: Nitish Kumar Reddy for Border-Gavaskar Trophy: Anil Kumble reveals reasonAnil Kumble explained why Nitish Kumar Reddy's maturity in white-ball cricket may have earned him a spot in India's squad for the Border-Gavaskar Trophy in Australia. Jemimah's father rubbishes claims of holding 'religious activities' at gymkhanaJemimah Rodrigues' father, Ivan, denied allegations of misusing her Khar Gymkhana membership for religious gatherings, clarifying that prayer meetings followed club protocols. All hopes not lost: When India chased down 300-plus target in 4th innings at homeIndia will be chasing a 300-plus target in their 4th innings vs New Zealand in the 2nd Test in Pune. The only instance of a team chasing down this many runs was when India chased down 387 runs against England in Chennai in 2008.

Krishan Pathak exclusive: '6 years with PR Sreejesh big help for my career'India goalkeeper Krishan Pathak credited his six-year experience with PR Sreejesh as essential to his growth, showing his skills with a crucial performance in India's 5-3 comeback win over Germany, marking a new era in Indian hockey.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
